thread.title: Tours and Parks News: Wildlife Events in Saba, Diving in Bonaire - The New York Times
thread.title_full: Tours and Parks News: Wildlife Events in Saba, Diving in Bonaire - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Tours and Parks News: Wildlife Events in Saba, Diving in Bonaire - The New York Times
text:
Continue reading the main story Share This Page Continue reading the main story Continue reading the main story SABA GOES WILD IN OCTOBER
On the rugged Dutch Caribbean island of Saba, visitors can eavesdrop on the echolocation of bats in new nocturnal “Batman Hikes” during October, deemed Environmental Awareness Month. Sponsored by a nonprofit environmental foundation, the campaign stages a series of Sea & Learn events featuring hands-on involvement with research biologists. New opportunities this year include collecting moth specimens, listening to whale “singing” with a marine biologist, searching for the island’s endangered racer snake and going on a geology tour by boat, taxi or hike.
In addition to guiding field expeditions, scientists offer evening presentations on their findings, often during happy hour events at local bars and restaurants. With the exception of school field trips, all activities are free and open to the public throughout October.
